decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture.&nbsp;</p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-ffee1cf4-7fff-825f-f24d-85356391fac4"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</span></span></p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of works, detailed drawings and full specifications of the proposed green/biodiverse roof shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The submission shall include cross-sectional drawings (scale 1:20) confirming a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, excluding the vegetative mat; a planting plan incorporating a diverse mix of species, including native species beneficial to local wildlife; and a management and maintenance plan to ensure the long-term success of the green roof. The approved details shall be fully implemented and retained thereafter.</p><p>REASON: To promote biodiversity on site.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specifications, a drainage layout, and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of the water butt with overflow shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p>REASON: To reduce the risk of flooding through SuDs.</p>
description: Demolition of existing rear extension and replacement with wrap-around extension
